gw.api.graph

Class Tree<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.graph.Tree<T>

  • public class Tree<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a tree as a specialized form of a graph.
    Author:
    bspies

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tree(T root)
      Creates a Tree with the root node.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(T parent, T child)
      Adds a parent-child relationship to the tree

      Adds a parent-child relationship to the tree with an attribute or label.
      T getChildOf(T parent, java.lang.Object attribute)
      Returns the child of the given parent where the edge has the given attribute.
      java.util.Collection<T> getChildrenOf(T parent)
      Returns the children of the given parent node.
      java.util.Collection<T> getLeaves()
      Returns a collection of all leaf nodes in the tree.
      T getParentOf(T child)
      Returns the parent of the given child, or null if the given node is the root of the tree.
      T getRoot()
      Get the root node.
      boolean hasNode(T node)
      Returns true if the tree has this node.
      Graph<T> toGraph()
      Returns the tree as a graph instance.

      • getParentOf

        public T getParentOf(T child)
        Returns the parent of the given child, or null if the given node is the root of the tree.
        Parameters:
        child - The child to find the parent of
        Returns:
        The parent, or null if the argument is the tree root

      • getChildOf

        @Nullable
public T getChildOf(T parent,
                    java.lang.Object attribute)
        Returns the child of the given parent where the edge has the given attribute.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node
        attribute - The relationship attribute
        Returns:
        The child represented by the attribute, or null if none
